events.title: Patron Saint Festival of San Juan Bautista
events.description: Experience the most important celebration of the year in honor of the town's patron saint. The community dresses up for the occasion with music, dance, faith, and joy.
details: Popular Fair with typical food (mole, tamales, carnitas)
Burning of the Castle and Fireworks

events.title: Day of the Dead: Honoring Our Ancestors
events.description: One of the deepest traditions where families welcome the souls of their deceased in an atmosphere of respect, memory, and color.
details: Family Altars with Marigolds and Copal Incense
Vigil and Tomb Cleaning at the Cemetery
Paths of Flowers to guide the souls
Offering with traditional food, pan de muerto, and fruit

events.title: Holy Week: Devotion and Solemnity
events.description: Lived with great religious fervor through processions and reenactments that commemorate the Passion of Christ.

events.title: Commemoration of the Battle of Puebla (Cinco de Mayo)
events.description: A day of regional pride remembering the bravery of the Zacapoaxtla Battalion in the historic battle against the French army.

events.title: Christmas Posadas
events.description: For nine nights, the community gathers to reenact the pilgrimage of Joseph and Mary, fostering unity and faith.
details: Distribution of Aguinaldos (little bags with candy and fruit)

events.title: Agricultural Cycle of Corn: From Seed to Harvest
events.description: Corn, the foundation of food and culture, dictates the rhythm of life with its planting and harvest cycles, intimately linked to the festivities.
details: April-May: Planting with the first rains
June-August: Growth and care of the cornfield
The harvested corn is offered on the Day of the Dead altars

events.title: Coffee Harvest
events.description: The Sierra Norte of Puebla is a coffee-growing region. This season is a time of great activity for families dedicated to this crop.
details: Sale or storage of parchment coffee

events.title: Christmas in the Sierra
events.description: Celebration of the birth of Christ that brings families together for a traditional dinner and acts of faith.
